body:
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. cast Progenitor Mimic - copying one creature
2. cast the second Progenitor Mimic, copying the first one
3. pass turn, next upkeep each Progenitor Mimic will create one token (making it 2 in total) What is the expected output? What do you see instead? http://gatherer.wizards.com/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=369001 4/15/2013 	
If you choose to have Progenitor Mimic enter the battlefield as a copy of a creature, the triggered ability it gains will become part of its copiable values. For example, suppose Progenitor Mimic enters the battlefield as a copy of Runeclaw Bear, a 2/2 green Bear creature with mana cost {1}{G}. The resulting object is a 2/2 green Bear creature named Runeclaw Bear with mana cost {1}{G} and with “At the beginning of your upkeep, if this creature isn't a token, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of this creature.” If another Progenitor Mimic enters the battlefield as a copy of that creature, it will be a Runeclaw Bear with two instances of the triggered ability.

Should be 3 tokens per turn, then. What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Linux Mint 16, magarena 1.48.827 If you are reporting a game play bug, please attach your game.log file. If you are reporting a crash, please attach both crash.log and game.log files (both files are found in the main game folder). Please provide any additional information below.
author: [Landhotel.Westerwald](https://code.google.com/u/Landhotel.Westerwald/)
